lexUnit.name: absurd.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: wildly unreasonable, illogical, or inappropriate

sentence.text: No objection had been raised at the time , he said , and ` it is absurd that they should start to quibble a week later and try to reopen the issue " .
It is absurd that French Railways can raise funds for new investment in the City of London , when British Rail is not allowed to do so .
But it would be absurd that he should be able to plead the jury 's verdict in the first trial as a bar to the second .
It felt absurd that we should be indoors poring over papers when we might have been out there , basking in dappled sunlight , bathing in the lake .
At first sight it is absurd to propose that Islamic socialization of the economy required the nihil obstat of everyone 's mother-in-law .
Yet the central point is that it is absurd to assume that any woman is less competent to direct her life than any man she marries .
It would be absurd to send a list of questions to the vendor , such as ` please confirm your roof is working properly " , ` please confirm there is nothing wrong with your foundations " .
But it is absurd to be unduly afraid of borrowing by the state .
It would be absurd to adopt a rigidly determinist view of what has gone on in the formation of culturally transmitted marriage laws .
Against rigorism , is the sense that it is rather absurd to lump all who are not utilitarian saints with actual wrongdoers .

In evidence I said that allergen extracts should be standardised and prepared according to good manufacturing practice and that it was absurd to inject patients with extracts of gas and petrol fumes .
It 's absurd to expect a heron to behave like a blackbird ! "
It 's absurd to go because you think I 'm angry .
It was absurd to imagine that a modern city could still evoke that kind of magic !
` Look , it 's absurd to stand here bandying words .
Cyprian thought it absurd to suppose that where there is no true eucharist ( in schism ) , there can be valid baptism .
“ And how absurd to think that there 's any need for all this cloak and dagger stuff …

Though literary festivals could be immensely enjoyable , especially if they took you to some pleasant distant city , like Toronto or Adelaide , there was something absurd about writers gathering together in this way .
In any case there is something absurd about the notion that language or words can be attacked independently of their users .
THERE is still something slightly absurd about the notion that 4,812,000 people cast their votes for Mr Dan Duffy .
If there was one thing not ugly and absurd about that marriage , it was a small but irreversible change in her own situation .
It would be absurd for Eliot to advocate that head-hunting would reinvigorate British society , just as it is absurdly funny to listen to the description of Sweeney 's ` missionary stew " .
Since the end of Athens ' archaic war with Eleusis it would have been absurd for any deme of Attica to think of rivalling Athens .
But would it be so absurd for those who sought refuge in tranquilisers or pep pills to try instead a course of Beethoven , Mozart or Chopin ?
Trouserless men looked absurd in socks .

The labels also tell us that the United States courts see nothing absurd in admitting the multiplicity of meanings that a statutory term can have , nor in accepting that the agency 's choice as to the precise meaning should govern .
Satan now seems absurd in raging against the omnipotence of God , he knows he can not possibly achieve anything by his rantings .
It is absurd to ` yearn to fly like the birds " when we have feet to get us where we want to go .
But it should be possible to create and enforce enough common rules to prevent the absurd see-sawing of industrial relations legislation we have seen since 1969 .
An ancient actor , with an absurd way of talking , taught elocution to the future preachers .
The classical progression is then to delusions of grandeur with absurd claims of past and present achievements .
He had the absurd conviction that his new boss would look after him , somehow explain things and make them right .
Such an absurd notion is entirely irrelevant to the debate , which is about colonialism and the right of small nations to exist , not ethnic purity or any other kind of purity .
The idea that we should divide our lives into three parts -- education/full-time work/retirement -- seems to me to be absurd .
` That 's absurd ! " said Mrs Lomax .
` You 're absurd !
" Do n't be so absurd .
They seemed faintly absurd .
Mr Clarke retorted that the BMA was being ` absurd " in trying to reopen the issue .
Indeed it would be quite absurd if companies can not correct any mistake if all interested parties agree .
` It was an outlandish , absurd and unbelievable thing for an intelligent young man to do , " he added .
